title: How Many Calories in a Vape?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a vape, including negligible nutritional impact from e-liquid, plus breakdowns and variations for vapers tracking intake.
h1: How Many Calories in a Vape?
assumptions: Standard disposable vape with 2ml e-liquid (propylene glycol, vegetable glycerin, nicotine, flavors); calories estimated from vaporized components, assuming minimal absorption.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by e-liquid composition, brand, flavors, and usage; vapes are not food—calories are negligible and not a primary concern. Consult health experts for vaping impacts.

quick_answer.text: A typical vape contains about 5 kcal from e-liquid ingredients, mostly from glycerin and any sweeteners.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts style but adapted for non-food item; totals are for one unit.

faqs.q: How many calories in a vape?
faqs.a: Approximately 5 kcal for a standard 2ml disposable vape, mainly from base ingredients.

faqs.q: Do vapes have carbs or sugars?
faqs.a: Minimal—about 1.2 g carbs and 0.5 g sugars per vape from flavors and glycerin.

faqs.q: Are there any proteins or fats in vape liquid?
faqs.a: No significant amounts; 0 g protein and 0 g fat per vape.

faqs.q: Does nicotine add calories to a vape?
faqs.a: No, nicotine itself has 0 calories; calories come from carriers like PG/VG.

faqs.q: How does e-liquid volume affect calories in a vape?
faqs.a: Larger capacity (e.g., 5ml) could double calories to ~10 kcal, depending on composition.
